intro: Dicliptera usambarica, commonly known as the Usambara dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to the East African region, particularly Tanzania. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, erect stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lobed flowers, which are typically pale green to brown in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or forested areas. Dicliptera usambarica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
